intro: Argyrolobium sericeum, commonly known as the silky burr veldt, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, known for its nitrogen-fixing abilities through symbiotic relationships with rhizobia bacteria. The plant produces small, yellow, pea-like flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are trifoliate, with hairy surfaces that give it a silvery appearance. Argyrolobium sericeum is adapted to arid environments and is often found in grasslands and rocky areas.
